free_text.Prérequis: Biophysics I, Biothermodynamics, Biomicroscopy I, + mandatory courses of M1

free_text.Forme d'enseignement: Laboratory practice and classroom data analysis
free_text.Contenu: The core of the course consists of 5 exercises that are meant to be performed in either 2 or 3 weeks/sessions each for a total of 11 weeks. [br/]The course also comprehends an introduction, instructions on how to write a notebook and on safe laboratory behavior to be held and discussed during the 1st and last week.[br/][br/]Ex 1: The exercise will introduce students to the fundamental elements of moving fluids in lab-on-a-chip (LOC) systems such as flows, pressure driven flow, electroosmotic driven flow, capillary effects, surface forces, mixing and two-phase flow.[br/]Ex 2: In the first part of this lab, students will replicate Perrin's work with modern equipment. Next they will investigate intracellular vesicle transport inside living cells and determine if the vesicle transport is accomplished by Brownian motion or by directed transport[br/]Ex 3: Optical trapping is one of the most successful technology transfers from a physics lab to biology. The goal of this exercise is to provide hands on experience to the bioengineering students of one of the mostly used single molecule technique.[br/]Ex 4: Modern bioanalytics is often based on surface detection of biomolecules. The exercise will explore different techniques for modification of most common biosensor and microbiosensors surfaces, such as gold and glass.[br/]Ex 5: The exercise consists in the employment of label-free biosensors for the observation of binding kinetics. Real-time protein bindings will be observed for different molecules.
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: [li] Let the students experience a variety of techniques employed in the bioengineering field and matching a quantitative and technological-based  approach[br/][li] Promote the microtechnology role in the life science community. Mimic a real research project and focusing on components such as keep a proper note book, safe behavior, scientific report writing[br/]
